name: Irish Soda Bread
description: You don’t need to be Irish to make this rustic, no-yeast bread! All of its leavening action comes from baking soda and buttermilk! This easy recipe requires no rise time and yields a deliciously crusty and moist loaf, ideal for dunking into stews!

ingredients.name: French Onion Dip Mix or 3 Onion Dip Mix

preparation:
1. Preheat oven to 425° F.
  2. Combine flours, oats, wheat germ, dip mix, salt and baking soda.
  3. Using a pastry blender, cut butter into dry ingredients until a coarse meal results.
  4. Add buttermilk, stir quickly and turn out onto a floured surface. Knead gently and form into a loaf. Place on Sheet Pan lined with Sheet Pan Liner.
  5. Dust with a little whole-wheat flour and cut a shallow X into the centre. Bake for 30 minutes.
tips: This recipe can be easily doubled to make 2 round, rustic loaves.
